channel.title: Part 1 on MPM2DP-0A Summative
channel.description: Recent content in Part 1 on MPM2DP-0A Summative

item.title: Unit 2
item.description: Lesson 1: Properties of Triangles Circumcentre The circumcentre is the intersection of all of the perpendicular bisectors of the sides of a triangle. It is equidistant from the vertices inside in acute triangles outside in obtuse triangles on $M_c$ where $c$ is the hypotenuse in right triangles Figure Description How to construct the circumcenter of a triangle. Also shows how to construct a circle through given three points.
